Outside encouragement, training eyed

Key lawmakers said today the suspected Boston Marathon bombers may have had help in planning the attacks. (11:37 a.m.)

Suspects' father postpones US trip

The father of the two Boston bombing suspects said he has postponed a trip from Russia to the United States because he is in poor health. (12:01 p.m.)

More victims leaving Boston hospitals

The number of patients being treated for injuries continues to drop, two weeks after the Boston Marathon attacks. (12:17 p.m.)

Pictures: Reconstructing the Marathon bombings

Panic erupted as the second bomb exploded near the finish line of the Boston Marathon on Monday, April 15, 2013. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
By early Tuesday, memorial for the victims of the attacks began to form on Boylston and Berkeley streets. Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe
Investigators mapped out a grid and numbered each piece of evidence. David L. Ryan/Globe Staff
Areas of Boston, such as City Hall, remained on high alert. Suzanne Kreiter/Globe Staff
FBI agents released images of the suspects on Thursday. Barry Chin/Globe Staff
MIT Police Officer Sean Collier was shot to death late Thursday near the school in Cambridge. Aram Boghosian for The Boston Globe
A wounded Dzokhar Tsarnaev was handcuffed, bringing the manhunt to an end. Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives

The chaos surrounding the Boston Marathon bombings began on the afternoon of April 15 and ended with gunfire and a massive manhunt on Friday, April 19. Click through the gallery of the reconstruction of last week’s agonizing events.

After attacks, police aim for measured response

In the wake of the marathon bombings, police and event planners are considering boosting security measures at music festivals, parades, and other large gatherings.
